speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE VI. Dunsinane. Before the castle.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Drum and colours. Enter MALCOLM, SIWARD, MACDUFF, and their Army, with boughs

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Now near enough: your leafy screens throw down.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: And show like those you are. You, worthy uncle,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Shall, with my cousin, your right-noble son,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Lead our first battle: worthy Macduff and we

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Shall take upon 's what else remains to do,

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Do we but find the tyrant's power to-night,

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Let us be beaten, if we cannot fight.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Make all our trumpets speak; give them all breath,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Those clamorous harbingers of blood and death.
